No.979/18 registered at Nigdi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354, 452 and 506 of the Indian Penal Code, under section 8 and 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that sister of victim lodged report stating that on 25/12/2018, she and victim aged about 17 years were in house.
At about 7.30 p.m., applicant came in their house, hold her left hand and kept his hand in neck of victim and pulled her on his person, asked them to go at terrace.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant, he is falsely implicated in this matter. His family members are depending upon him. He is only earning member in his family. Investigation is practically over. He is permanently residing at Nigdi, Dist­Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

His family members are depending upon him.

arguments.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application.

Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Statements of most of the witnesses are recorded. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is earning member of family and his family members are depending upon him. Applicant is resident of Nigdi Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. Therefore, application deserves to be allowed with following order:

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is interrogated.
Statements of most of the witnesses are recorded.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is earning member of family and his family members are depending upon him.
Applicant is resident of Nigdi Pune.
He has no criminal antecedents.
Therefore, application deserves to be allowed with following order:

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Sagar Ramdas Jadhav be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.20,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution evidence in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Nigdi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not harass, meet victim and threat and pressurize the victim or first informant and witnesses. 6] Applicant shall not repeat offence and shall not enter in the vicinity of residence of victim. 7] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 8] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 5/19 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. No.979/18 registered at Nigdi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354, 452 and 506 of the Indian Penal Code, under section 8 and 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that sister of victim lodged report stating that on 25/12/2018, she and victim aged about 17 years were in house. At about 7.30 p.m., applicant came in their house, hold her left hand and kept his hand in neck of victim and pulled her on his person, asked them to go at terrace. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant, he is falsely implicated in this matter. His family members are depending upon him. He is only earning member in his family. Investigation is practically over. He is permanently residing at Nigdi, Dist­Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Statements of most of the witnesses are recorded. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is earning member of family and his family members are depending upon him. Applicant is resident of Nigdi Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. Therefore, application deserves to be allowed with following order: 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Sagar Ramdas Jadhav be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.20,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution evidence in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Nigdi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not harass, meet victim and threat and pressurize the victim or first informant and witnesses. 6] Applicant shall not repeat offence and shall not enter in the vicinity of residence of victim. 7] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 8] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.
---order-ends---
 sd/­­ Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date –22.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 5/19 “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ P. P. Bokil Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 22­01­2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 22­01­2019 Order uploaded on ­ 22­01­2019
